meaning_str.bing:
n. 职业；事业；生涯；经历
adj. 〈美〉职业性质的
v. 飞奔
网络. 职业生涯；工作；专业

工作；事业；职业；生涯；职业生涯；专业道路；发展历程
（尤指失控地）猛冲；疾驰；飞奔；急速运动

1.en: When Mr Lampert said he wanted to quit, Mr Rubin told him he was giving up a golden career.
1.cn: 当拉姆伯特将辞职想法告诉罗宾时，罗宾说他放弃的是锦绣前程。

2.en: He said that he was happy about the award in New York, but that it certainly did not represent the winding up of his career.
2.cn: 他表示很高兴能在纽约获此殊荣，但这绝不表明他的电影事业就此划上了句号。

3.en: Women who qualified as accountants or lawyers do not generally have MBAs: others got into a fast-paced career and never looked back.
3.cn: 拿过会计师或律师资格的女CEO一般没有MBA学位：其他人进入一个快速上升的职业通道，从不回头。

0.en: And the other half of the Career Pack, Brutus and Enobaria. What's with her teeth?
0.cn: 职业组的另一半，布鲁托和伊诺贝丽，从小就是职业选手。她的牙怎么了？

1.en: I've made a career out of dealing with problematic parts of the world.
1.cn: 我的职业就是处理世界的问题地区。

2.en: Your career and your life will have starts and stops and zigs and zags.
2.cn: 你的职业和生活会有始终，会有曲折。

3.en: Do you have aspirations for a career, or a professional dream that you wish to pursue?
3.cn: 你有没有想要从事的事业想要实现的职业梦想？

4.en: This is the single greatest day of my professional career. Gunther. Six glasses.
4.cn: 这是我职业生涯中最伟大的一天。冈瑟,，6个杯子。

5.en: That's it? You're gonna let me do this? This is my career we're talking about here!
5.cn: 就这样？你真要让我这样做？这事关我的职业生涯耶。

6.en: Well, very nice. Good for you guys. So this is what career day is really all about.
6.cn: 挺好，你们这样挺好，这才是职业日这个活动的真谛所在。

7.en: Yeah, well, I'm kinda heading in a new career direction and you know, you gotta start at the bottom. Dude.
7.cn: 我在转换职业跑道中，得要从基层做起。老兄。

8.en: He'll have his arm around Peter at the biggest moment of his career. That'll leave a mark.
8.cn: 在他职业生涯中最重要的一刻，他会紧密跟随彼得，这必会留下污点。

9.en: But the book. My entire career. It's all based on a lie. You don't have a monopoly on secrets.
9.cn: 但那本书，我整个职业生涯，都是基于一个谎言。秘密不是你一个人的专属。

10.en: You gave your own father an experimental drug. I could finish your career with one phone call.
10.cn: 你给自己的父亲用上了实验中的药物，我一个电话就可以结束你的职业生涯。

11.en: This gun was illegally obtained by a career criminal at a gun show where background checks aren't mandatory.
11.cn: 这把枪是一个职业罪犯非法地在一个不强制背景审查的枪展上购得的。

12.en: Your monkey found a new career, in the entertainment field. That's all I know. This is unbelievable.
12.cn: 你的猴子有了新职业了，往娱乐界发展去了，我只知道这一些。真是令人难以置信。

13.en: Are you kidding me? You've set my career back at least two years, and you think you can make it right with I'm sorry?
13.cn: 你开什么玩笑？你害得我的职业发展倒退了至少两年，你觉得说句抱歉就能算了吗？

14.en: Okay, well, do you want to go? Of course not. I'm a theoretical physicist. A career I chose in no small part because it's indoors.
14.cn: 那你想去吗？当然不想，我是理论物理学家，我选这个职业完全出于能在家办公。

15.en: All right, future history makers, welcome to career day. Now there are a lot of ways to make your mark on the world.
15.cn: 好的，未来的历史缔造者们，欢迎来到职业日。你们能在这个世界留下痕迹的方式有很多种。

16.en: No. Well, I like the idea of art, the beauty. But only in the right context. Just not as a career. I don't have the necessary talents.
16.cn: 不，呃，我欣赏艺术的理念，还有它的美，但只是在特定的条件下，但我不想把它当成职业，我自知没有那方面的天分。

17.en: I've done over 35,000 interviews in my career. and as soon as that camera shuts off, everyone always turns to be and inevitably in their own way ask this question: Was that okay?
17.cn: 在我的职业生涯中，曾经做过35000次访谈，每当摄影机关掉的时候，所有的受访者必然会用自己的方式问出这样一个问题：我表现得还可以吧？

18.en: Okay, that's it. I hate to be the feminist here, between the two of us, but you should be able to have a huge career and be who you are without having to accept that your husband is having an affair as some kind of payback.
18.cn: 好了，没了。我不想再我们俩之间做支持女权的那个，但你应该拥有一个好的职业，做你自己，别就认为你丈夫出轨是对你的报复

19.en: This kind of experience happens to everyone. It will happen to you. You will lose something, or someone you think you can't live without. Or you will suffer a terrible illness or injury, or your career will fall apart before your eyes.
19.cn: 没有人能幸免这种事。它会发生在你身上。你会失去一切失去不能失去的人。或者会遭受严重的疾病或伤害，或者眼见着自己的职业生涯分崩离析。
